content:
1. Heavy or painful periods: Fibroids may cause heavy or prolonged menstrual bleeding, which can result in anemia and fatigue.

2. Bleeding between periods: Fibroids can cause bleeding or spotting between periods, which can be a sign of hormonal imbalance.

3. Urinary problems: The pressure from fibroids on the bladder can cause frequent urination, difficulty urinating, and even urinary incontinence.

4. Bowel problems: Fibroids can put pressure on the rectum, causing constipation, bloating, and discomfort during bowel movements.

5. Abdominal swelling: Large fibroids may cause the uterus to enlarge, leading to a noticeable bulge in the abdomen.

6. Pain during sex: Fibroids can cause pain or discomfort during sex due to their size and location.

7. Infertility: In some cases, fibroids can interfere with conception or a pregnancy by blocking the fallopian tubes or disrupting the position of the uterus.
